page.title: 13OUR LOCAL M.P.
page.content: Humphrey Malins, elected June 1983 General Election. Surgeries held locally 1st and 3rd Fridays. An Average Day: He starts his day by opening his mail - he usually receives about 100 letters a day. Most of the letters are written to him about problems in our area such as housing difficulties, un- even pavements, crime and transport. Some of the letters he passes on to other M.P.'s who may be able to help. Mr. Malins goes to the House of Commons at 2.30pm. He may take part in debates or he may see constituents about their problems. The House usually sits till 10 pm with voting starting about 7 pm. Sometimes debates can cont- inue until 7 am. On Fridays they sit in the morning which gives Mr. Malins an afternoon to spend in the constituency. He spends Sundays with his family.
